publicationStmt.p: Digital edition hosted on http://rickandmorty.newtfire.org and GitHub: https://github.com/dorothealint/Rick-and-Morty

encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and adding names and scene cuts.

body.stage: [Rick, Morty, and Summer all fall out of a portal into the garage]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Summer, next time we're hiding in a Colorkian echo nest, can you do me a favor and turn your ringer off?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : It's called "carpe diem", Morty. Look it up.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You look it up! Y-Y-You don't even-You don't even know what it means!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : That's because losers look stuff up while the rest of us are carpin' all them diems.

body.stage: [Summer hi-fives Rick]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Listen to your sister, Morty. To live is to risk it all. Otherwise, you're just an inert chunk of randomly assembled molecules drifting wherever the universe blows you. Oh, I'm sorry, Jerry, I didn't see you there. H-How much of that did you hear?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : All of it. You were looking right at me. I just wanted to say goodbye to the kids.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Cool. Just stay in the driveway. The killbots are live, and I took you off the whitelist.

body.stage: [Rick begins using a screwdriver on a gun]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : W-We'll see you every other weekend, though, right?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Absolutely, Morty. A-And your mom's lawyer says if I can get enough in the settlement, he can help me sue for full custody.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Th-That'll be nice. Uh, Summer, Dad's leaving!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Bye, Dad. Rick, didn't you say you needed my help on an adventure immediately somewhere else I don't care even if it might kill us?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I did not, but if you're really that alienated, I'm as willing to exploit it as the next guy, church, army, or Olympic gymnastics trainer.

body.stage: [Rick shoots open a portal in the ground]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I'm ready when you a--

body.stage: [Summer jumps into the portal and exits]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Bitch, I was ready yest--

body.stage: [Rick jumps into the portal and exits]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Bye, sweetie.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Well, I-I better--

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Sure. Sounds important.

body.stage: [Morty jumps into the portal and exits]
[Beth enters the garage]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: If you're looking for our kids, your father did a-a portal, uh--

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Okay.

body.stage: [Beth exits. Jerry begins to walk out of the garage but stops. Some leaves blow in the wind]

sp.speaker: Wind
sp.p: : (faint) Loser...

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : What? Hello?

body.stage: [Transition to Rick driving Summer and Morty in a turquoise car through the desert, being chased by other cars]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Morty, shoot the mohawk guy!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : They all have mohawks!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : High fade, chartreuse with cyan highlights, layered on top. Shoot him!

body.stage: [Morty loads a shotgun and shoots at the vehicle behind them, but misses, while Mohawk Guy jumps onto the back of their car]

sp.speaker: Mohawk Guy
sp.p: : Ah!

sp.speaker: Death Stalker #1
sp.p: : Light them up.

sp.speaker: Mohawk Guy
sp.p: : Ahh!

body.stage: [Mohawk Guy presses a button and self-destructs]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Fuck! Get in the game, Morty!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Give me your flask!

body.stage: [Rick hands Summer his flask. Summer chugs some alcohol from it, then spits it into the engine, propelling the car forward]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Holy shit, Summer for the win!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I fucking love post-apocalyptic versions of Earth!

body.stage: [A machine begins to beep rapidly.]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Here we go.

body.stage: [Rick pulls the car over, as him, Summer, and Morty all exit.]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Isotope 322. [Rick picks up a glowing green shard with a pair of tweezers and puts it into a container. It floats in the container.] This stuff's so powerful, Morty, it makes Isotope 465 look like Isotope 317.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Uh-huh, yeah, is it powerful enough to keep those guys from murdering us?!

body.stage: [Morty points towards the car that was coming towards them which is quickly approaching them. Summer grabs a shotgun from the front seat of the car]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Summer!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Hold on. I want to try something.

body.stage: [Rick shoots the portal gun at the ground, opening up a portal]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick, can we not leave without my sister?!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ugh. You have infinite sisters, Morty. I mean, n-not that I want to spend the rest of my day looking for another one. Sum-sum, let's go! Grandpa's concern for your safety is fleeting!

sp.speaker: Colossus
sp.p: : Your blood will be my lotion.

body.stage: [Summer aims the shotgun at Colossus's car, which is now directly in front of her, and shoots at the front tire. The car flips over and Colossus flies out.]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Whoa. That was cool.

body.stage: [Colossus claws his way away from the ruined car and looks up at Summer]

sp.speaker: Colossus
sp.p: : Kill me, please.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Okay, but not because you told me to.

body.stage: [Summmer shoots and kills Colossus]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: :Summer!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Okay, getting darker.

body.stage: [Summer turns around to see a fleet of cars coming towards her. She puts one foot on Colossus's dead body.]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Jesus Christ. Summer!

body.stage: [Morty runs towards Summer]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Aw, come on.

body.stage: [Rick, annoyed, runs after Morty while taking a gun out of his coat pocket. Hemorrhage exits his car and puts a fist up to the men behind him, who are also exiting their cars.]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hands and little shoulder-mounted dudes where I can see them!

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : I am Hemorrhage. You have removed weak blood from us and made us stronger. We can combine our strength and feast on the weak together.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Wh-Wh-What in the hell are you saying?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : They don't have to keep trying to kill us if we join them. They're basically pussies.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What is your deal lately?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right, let's get sloppy. Oh, whoa. Uh, uh, what's, uh-What's that little bauble you got back there? [Rick points at a glowing green rock positioned atop a small hill] Th-Th-That's interesting.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : That is our glowing rock. We carry it with us for desecration, to remind us there are no gods.

body.stage: [Rick holds up machine which was beeping before and it begins to beep again in the presence of the rock]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Kids, weird pitch: let's have this be our new life. Let's be post-apocalyptic scavengers!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : (grinning) Okay.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What?!

body.stage: [Transition to Death Stalkers camp. Rick, Morty, and Summer are waiting in a lunch line.]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa, some of the Death Stalkers are going to what used to be Seattle to hunt what used to be people. I'm going.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Sounds good. Stay hydrated.

body.stage: [Summer exits]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Listen, Rick, Summer's been acting pretty crazy lately. You know, I mean, I-I think the divorce is affecting her. And, you know, I don't think this is a great place for her to be right now.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, get off your high horse, Professor Ski Lodge. This world may be rough around the edges, but it's got its charms.

sp.speaker: Lunch server
sp.p: : Bicep or quadricep?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Uh... [clears throat] bicep.

body.stage: [The lunch server puts a human bicep onto Rick's plate. Rick takes a piece off of it, observes it, then eats it. He chews it for a while while Morty angrily stares at him]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : (after a short pause) Seriously, Rick? Is it really easier to eat human flesh than to just tell me why we're still here?

body.stage: [Rick takes the piece he was chewing out of his mouth]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No. Okay, I'll level with you.

body.stage: [Rick grabs Morty by the arm and drags him to the glowing green rock, which some Death Stalkers are happily gathered around]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You see that green rock, Morty? It's about 20 pounds of the stuff I was getting all hard for a flake of.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Isotope 322.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well, having a 20-pound boulder of it is better than having a flake. I can explain the math to you later, but--

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Summer just ran off with strangers that have "Death" in their name, and the rest of their name was "Stalkers"!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Huh, could be therapeutic for her. She has been acting pretty crazy lately, Morty. I mean, her parents are going through a divorce.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Damn it, Rick, that's what I-- Fine. Just grab the stupid thing while I grab her, and let's get the "F" out of "H"!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No, no, no. Morty, there's too much heat on the bogey. I need you to distract the camp.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : "Distract"? They eat each other. Wha-What do you want me to do to get their attention, put on a puppet show?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Right idea, wrong genre, Morty. The equivalent here would be... [Rick glances over at the Blood Dome] Hey, you guys ever use that Thunderdome, or do you just put it up for decoration?

sp.speaker: Death Stalker #2
sp.p: : Uh, you mean the Blood Dome?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Save it for the Semantics Dome, E.B. White.

sp.speaker: Death Stalker #3
sp.p: : (offscreen) Ooh, burn!

body.stage: [Rick snaps his fingers and points a finger gun at Death Stalker #3 while winking]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : The important question is, who wants to take a poke at my man Spine Eater here? [Rick points at Morty. The Death Stalkers cheer] I guess I'll see your asses in that dome!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick, what the hell, man?! Wh-What are you, out of your mind?!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p:
: Morty, relax. You're gonna be a ringer. Come here. [Rick drags Morty by the arm and takes him behind a truck. He pulls out a device] This device extracts and redistributes muscle memory. [Rick sticks the syringe part of the device into a dangling, muscular arm and pulls out some red liquid from it as the arm shrinks]
I'm giving your body a 10-year course in wasteland combat one limb at a time.

body.stage: [Rick sticks the syringe into Morty's arm]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ow!

body.stage: [Morty's arm begins to swell up and turn into Armothy]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I'm working with a mixed bag here, so you may not have perfect coordination, Morty-- [Rick sticks the syringe into another arm and extracts more red liquid, but Armothy slaps the device out of his hand] Ugh! Hey!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I-I didn't do that!

body.stage: [Morty punches Rick with Armothy and Rick's nose begins to bleed]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Okay, this is exciting. We're making some discoveries about muscle memory.

body.stage: [Armothy starts moving Morty toward the Blood Dome]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ooh! Help! Help!

body.stage: [Armothy grabs onto the Blood Dome. Morty jumps in and crushes a Death Stalker with Armothy]

sp.speaker: Death Stalker #4
sp.p: : Oh, sweet, man!

sp.speaker: Eli
sp.p: : And so it begins, my pretties!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, God! Stop! Stop! This is horrible!

body.stage: [Morty chokes another Death Stalker with Armothy]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Just stick and moo-[burps]-oove, Morty! Wear him out!

body.stage: [Rick walks towards the glowing rock. Transition to Summer, Hemorrhage, and Blue Footprint Guy walking through an abandoned city, while Hemorrhage and Blue Footprint Guy shoot and kill some mutants]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : How come you guys dress like you're in a theme-park stunt show, but these guys wear khakis and hockey jerseys?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : After the "boom-boom", some adapted to the new truth, and some chose to huddle near the boomy holes, clinging to the lie of the beforefore times. The raidy-rays rotted them away, leaving only their love for the vertvertisements on billyboards.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Jesus Christ, did the "boomy-booms" blow up all your "wordy-word books"?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : You mean dictionaries?

body.stage: [Four mutants charge towards Summer and Hemorrhage. They shoot and kill all of them. Hemorrhage leans over to look at the fallen billboard advertisement. He touches an image of a young boy]

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : I think I was a child before the boom-booms. I think I looked like this.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Want to piss on it?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Get out of my head.

body.stage: [Transition to Morty in the Blood Dome, smashing a Death Stalker's head with Armothy]

sp.speaker: Eli
sp.p: : Ha ha! Whoo! Unbelievable! A new champ!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Okay, no more!

body.stage: [Armothy gestures for more]

sp.speaker: Eli
sp.p: : And he wants more!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : No, I don't!

body.stage: [Armothy does Hulk Hogan's "I can't hear you" pose]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Someone, make this stop!

body.stage: [Another Death Stalker jumps into the Blood Dome]

sp.speaker: Death Stalker#7
sp.p: Mister, please get out of here, or you're gonna die! [The Death Stalker runs up to Morty] I have nothing to do with this!

body.stage: [Summer and Hemorrhage walk up to the Blood Dome]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Morty.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : (while beating up the Death Stalker) Why would you want this to happen? All you had to do was go away! Stop standing in the driveway talking about custody! And either tell her you want to stay married or get on with your life, but whatever you do, stop being a baby and act like a man! [Armothy punches off the man's head. Morty looks at Armothy] Thank you.

body.stage: [Armothy gives a thumbs up. Summer runs up to Morty and gives him a hug]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Morty, that was amazing! This is my brother! Not that family means anything!

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : This family does.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right. Good job, champ. Um, can I talk to you kids for a second over yonder?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick, I-I-I think I'm breaking through to something here. C-Can we not leave just yet?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Leave?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I'm not leaving.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : There is no "leave". We are united, or we are enemies.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, big guy, no. Nobody's leaving. Don't be stupid. We love being united. We love the radiation, the trichinosis. We're in it for life, which I assume is around 20 years, average. I just need a quick aside with my grandkids, about 40 yards from anyone else.

sp.speaker: Death Stalker #5
sp.p: : Hey, the Green Rock is gone!

sp.speaker: Death Stalker #6
sp.p: : (offscreen) Oh, no!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Uh, I know why don't we all split up and look for it in groups of three? Kids? [Armothy pulls the green rock out of Rick's messenger bag] Ooh. [Rick pulls out a gun] We'll be right back.

body.stage: [Transition to Rick driving quickly through the desert, holding a gun and being trailed by Death Stalkers. Summer and Hemorrhage, who are driving together, drive next to him.]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa, you're being stupid! Just surrender, and our friends will give you mercy!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Kiss my ass, Summer! Your friends have no mercy! [Rick shoots and kills two female Death Stalkers] They're lame!

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Death Stalkers, bring me his flesh leather!

body.stage: [A Death Stalker with a knife jumps onto Rick's car. Morty pulls up to Rick's car and shoots the Death Stalker, while Armothy drives]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Sorry, but can we not kill him? C-Can we just take him prisoner?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : When did I lose control here?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Listen to me! Both of you kids need to get out of this environment so we can properly deal with your parents' divorce! Alternatively, I have a freaking portal gun, and I can leave the two of you here forever!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Why does it have to be such a dramatic choice? Can't we arrange a thing where we spend weekends here or or visit home to do laundry?

body.stage: [A Death Stalker with a turret shoots at Rick's car]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right, you know what? Fuck it!

body.stage: [Rick shoots a portal at the ground in front of him. The front of his car falls into the portal while the back gets stuck in the other universe, which causes the car behind him to flip over. Transition to Rick in the front of the car which is hanging from the ceiling of the garage. He begins to exit, but Blue Footprint Guy assaults him from the passenger seat. He begins to choke Rick.]

sp.speaker: Blue Footprint Guy
sp.p: : My body is chrome! My blood is gasoline!

body.stage: [Rick kicks Blue Footprint Guy off of him and he falls under the car, which also falls onto his head, crushing and killing him]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Nope, regular blood.

body.stage: [Beth enters from inside the house]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Dad?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hi, sweetie.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Where are the kids?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, th-they aren't with you? I thought they were with you. Oh, y-you know what? Uh, I just remembered. They're out doing something completely ordinary and kid-related. Don't panic.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Not panicked. At all. [Rick pulls out a flask from his coat and nervously drinks] Just...Oh, God, what's the divorce doing to the kids? What's it doing to me? Did I make a mistake?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Not a mistake, no! [Rick puts the flask back in his coat] I mean, not that I have a horse in this race, but this divorce decision listen, [Rick does an Italian chef kiss] mwah! Good for you, good for the kids. I mean, honestly, I think that they're flourishing. I mean, you'll see, when when when you see them, that that they're totally flourishing.

body.stage: [Transition to Morty, angrily beating up and killing another Death Stalker in the Blood Dome]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Booyah! Fuck you, pal! Who else wants some? Who wants to be my pussy of a dad today? [Armothy waves in front of Morty's face] Hey, what's what's wrong, man? You're not getting weak on me, are you?

body.stage: [Armothy points up at a man sitting in the bleachers outside of the Blood Dome. He is wearing a soldier's armor]

sp.speaker: Soldier
sp.p: : What? Wait a minute.

body.stage: [Transition to a first-person flashback of Armothy chopping wood in a quaint, peaceful village. He stops when he hears a woman scream, and looks up to find houses burning and men riding in on horses, shooting at the villagers with bows and killing a man. Transition to the village burning, with Armothy lying on the ground with a large cut in his wrist. The soldier from the bleachers walks up to him]

sp.speaker: Soldier
sp.p: : What's the matter, you piece of crap? Haven't you ever watched your family burn to death before? Now I'm gonna whip you. Ha!

body.stage: [The soldier whips Armothy. Transition to present time, with Armothy still pointing at the soldier in the bleachers]

sp.speaker: Soldier
sp.p: : It can't be. It can't be! [The soldier jumps off the bleachers and is running away] I was just following orders --

body.stage: [Morty starts getting moved towards the man by Armothy]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Whoa, whoa!

sp.speaker: Soldier
sp.p: : -- I was just following orders!

body.stage: [Armothy swings open the door to the Blood Dome, which knocks over a Death Stalker]

sp.speaker: Death Stalker #7
sp.p: : Ahh!

sp.speaker: Soldier
sp.p: : I'll tell you where my boss lives! He's in the castle! [Armothy punches the soldier into a couch] He's in the castle! [Armothy picks up a torch and throws it at the soldier, setting him on fire and killing him] Ahh! Aggggh!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : This isn't over, is it?

body.stage: [Armothy gives a thumbs-down]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : That means, no, it isn't over, or you disapprove of the question? [Armothy shakes his hand and puts his pointer finger up, then gives another thumbs-down] Uh, m-make a fist if this isn't over. [Armothy makes a fist] This isn't over.

body.stage: [Transition to Hemorrhage, using the a wrench on the engine of a car. He throws the wrench onto the ground]

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Ugh!

body.stage: [Summer enters]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Hey, sorry my Grandpa stole your god and ruined your car.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : We don't apologize, and we have no god. But this cracked drive shaft brings me great pain. There is no deeper bond than the one between a Death Stalker and his car.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : What about the weird guys on leashes, then?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : They're more like interns.

body.stage: [Hemorrhage pulls out an adjustable wrench from behind him]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Cool, cool.

body.stage: [Hemorrhage drops the wrench. Summer and Hemorrhage both reach for it.]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Sorry.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : It's okay.

body.stage: [Summer touches Hemorrhage's helmet]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Can I see?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : No one has seen my true face and lived.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Well, I'm not afraid to die, and I don't care what you look like. [Hemmorhage starts to pull off his helmet. Summer gasps. Hemmorhage pulls off his helmet. He is a blonde man with a mustache.] Oh.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Hmm?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I just...I didn't expect you to have a mustache.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : You hate it.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : No. I like it. I guess -- How do I explain this? A metal bucket is, on a certain level, a kind of "mustache," in that it's a specific facial accessory. So, it's kind of like...Do you guys have the phrase "hat on a hat"?

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : I can shave it.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : No. I like it. And obviously what I like shouldn't matter. It's you.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Yeah, yeah, I know, a-and nothing does matter. Obviously, I know that. I'm not weak. I'm just thinking, "Well, why not get rid of this?" You just kill everyone that sees it, and it's and it's hot under here (looks at helmet) wh-which, by the way, is why I shave the beard part. So, right there, I'm making a decision based on vanity, which is what I was trying to avoid with the whole bucket over the head because who am I and why am I grooming myself? Why don't I just wear a tie, right? I mean, it's like that guy you killed when I met you, with the burnt dolls on his body. I hated that guy, because, why-why are you doing that? And how can you not see how fake that is? And the whole time, I'm the same thing. I'm just a fake mess, and there's no escaping it because --

body.stage: [Summer kisses Hemorrhage. They start making out on a table. A man in a mask on a leash crawls into the hut]

sp.speaker: Leash Man
sp.p: : Hey, I'm doing a coffee run -- Never mind.

body.stage: [The man on the leash crawls back out. Transition to Rick, positioning the head of Mechanical Summer. He flips a switch on the back of her neck]

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : I am Summer.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Summer, state your deal.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : My deal is that I am, like, totally fine.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Morty?

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : Aw, geez, I'm so down with my parents' divorce, dawg. Like, don't even trip, like, in a healthy way.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right. [Rick rubs his hands together] It's dinnertime.

body.stage: [Transition to the dinner table. Beth drinks a glass of wine]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Thanks, everybody, for sitting down for a real dinner.

body.stage: MS, MR, and Rick, in unison: No problem.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : Its benefits are totally, like, less about the food than the emotional nourishment.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Uh, okay, weirdo. [laughs]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ah ha ha ha, yeah. Dial it back, Summer. By 15% and increase dynamic movement by 3. Am I right?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : How's school, Morty?

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : I like school and stuff, kind of. And I'm getting better grades than when you and Dad were -- quote mode -- "staying together for the kids." End quote mode.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : "Quote mode". I like that. You millennials. Are you guys millennials, or are they like 40 now?

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : All I know is, totally, you look great.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : Aw, geez, Mom, you look all kind of great and stuff. It's crazy.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : So happy.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : So happy. Happy family, man. We got this family in the bag.

body.stage: [Beth starts to cry]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, sweetie, d-don't. Listen. Don't --

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : I don't know why I'm crying. It's not --

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well, try crying 15% less?

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : Mom, emotions are human. You're not, like, a computer inside a mechanical doll.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : Yeah. Geez, Mom. Your feelings are not only forgivable, they are the very meaning of life that only pre-silicon, carbon-based entities can ever grasp.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : I have to call Jerry.

body.stage: [Beth gets out of her chair and walks to the kitchen]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You do?! What the fuck is wrong with you two? The point of automation is to reduce cost and labor.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : Your feelings are coming from a --

body.stage: [Rick flips the switch on the back of Mechanical Summer's neck. She turns off and her face falls into the spaghetti]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Tell it to my bread in the morning. You just became my backup toaster.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : Aw, geez, my sister died in the spaghetti --

body.stage: [Rick turns Mechanical Morty off and his face also falls into his spaghetti. Transition to Morty and Armothy sneaking into a castle. They fight and kill two guards. Transition to the Slaveowner sitting in a bathtub, with two blonde boys sitting on either side of him]

sp.speaker: Slaveowner
sp.p: : Graze my genitals again, Taint Washer, and you'll be shipped to the wasteland. And as for you, Genital Washer --

body.stage: [Morty bursts in through a window]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ahh! Oh, gee!

body.stage: [Genital Washer and Taint Washer run out of the room. Two soldiers charge towards Morty. Armothy kills them both, picks up one of their swords and drops it. He moves Morty towards the slaveowner and cracks his knuckles]

sp.speaker: Slaveowner
sp.p: : Oh, god. Look, whoever you are, you should know that killing me won't change a thing.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : L-Look, man, I'm just along for the ride on this one. You know, y-y-y-y-you're preaching to the choir here.

sp.speaker: Slaveowner
sp.p: : Please. Slavery was a family business. I didn't ask to be born into it. If anything, I'm the victim here!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Uh, Armothy, can I steal you for a second? E-E-Excuse us, sir. [Morty turns away from the slaveowner] So, this is it, isn't it? This is the guy? [Armothy shakes his fist "yes"] So, does that mean you'll be going away? Like, does it work like a ghost? Like, is is this your unfinished business? [Armothy gives a "so-so" gesture] Wh-What if we didn't do it? What if we just went back to the Blood Dome and just kept taking our baggage out on unrelated people? [Morty tears up] I mean, w-we could do that forever. I mean, I-I know it's less healthy, but w-w-we'd be together and --

body.stage: [Armothy puts a "hush" finger up to Morty's mouth]

sp.speaker: Slaveowner
sp.p: : I mean, I-I know what I'd vote for, if you're feeling out the room.

body.stage: [Armothy points at the slaveowner, then wipes away Morty's tears]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You're right. We both got to see our stuff through. I got to deal with my parents' divorce, and you got to, you know, do what you got to do. I love you.

body.stage: [Armothy and Morty hug/Morty hugs himself]

sp.speaker: Slaveowner
sp.p: : Aw, fuck!

body.stage: [Armothy starts to choke the slaveowner, while Morty notices that Rick is holding some vials on the other side of the room]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Sorry, sorry. I-I-I can wait for this to wrap up. Don't let me distract you.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yeah, well, too late. [Armothy dunks the slaveowner's head underwater] Just tell me what you want.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I want you and your sister to come home.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, but don't don't you have infinite versions of me and my sister?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You don't have to kick me while I'm down, Morty. Look, there's no replacing either of you without an amount of work that would ultimately defeat the purpose.

body.stage: [Armothy continues to choke the slaveowner underwater. The slaveowner loses consciousness]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Maybe the lesson we've learned is that, whether it's our parents' marriage, a glowing green rock, or an awesome, giant arm, sooner or later, we got to let it go.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I don't know if that applies to the throats of murder victims, Morty.

body.stage: [The slaveowner starts gasping for air in between gargles of water]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: :Shit! Wh-Wh-Wh-What do I --

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well, the longer you wait, Morty, the more it's gonna feel like committing a whole murder. I think your arm just called it too early because it wasn't the arm of a paramedic. Here. [Rick takes Morty's hand and puts it around the slaveowner's throat, choking him] It's the least I can do. I-I-I-I owe you this much. See, Morty? Now we're both accountable.

body.stage: [Transition to Summer and Hemorrhage driving a car through the desert, with a fleet of other cars next to them, with Rick and Morty driving towards them from the opposite directiion. Summer and Hemorrhage pull their car over and so do Rick and Morty. The four exit their vehicles with Rick holding the glowing green rock.]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : The reason I wanted this is because it can do this. [Rick puts a lightbulb on top of the rock and it lights up] This is a really special thing. I mean, you could use it to power all your vehicles. You wouldn't be reliant on gasoline. You'll be the most advanced tribe of radioactive cannibals in the whole -- [Rick gives the rock to Hemorrhage] -- this version of the world.

body.stage: [Rick shoots a portal at the ground and starts walking towards it]

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Wait. Can you stay to show us more?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You don't have to ask me twice. Home is nuts right now. My daughter's going through a divorce, and I am not dealing with it in a healthy way at all.

body.stage: [A title card reads "THREE WEEKS LATER". Transition to an overhead shot of the Death Stalkers' village, which is now a suburb with wires providing power with Isotope 322. Transition to Summer, pulling into a driveway, wearing armor with her hair disheveled. A grocery bag in the car filled with human limbs is knocked over and some fall out. Eli is mowing his lawn next door.]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Ugh. Goddamn it.

body.stage: [Summer picks up the limbs that fell out and holds the grocery bag along with a purse]

sp.speaker: Eli
sp.p: : Hi, there, Summer! How were the ruins today?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, you know, Eli. Same shit, different day.

sp.speaker: Eli's Girlfriend
sp.p: : Hey, Summer! Guess what. One man entered, one man comes out in nine months.

body.stage: [Eli's Girlfriend pats her stomach]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, congratulations, guys.

body.stage: [Summer pulls a keyring out of her bag]

sp.speaker: Eli
sp.p: : Uh, Summer, one more thing. We noticed that you've been putting scrap metal in the blue bin --

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I got it.

body.stage: [Summer exits into her house]

sp.speaker: Eli's Girlfriend
sp.p: : She's a piece of work.

sp.speaker: Eli
sp.p: : They both are, right?

body.stage: [Transition to Summer inside the house. Rick, Morty, and Hemorrhage all sit on a couch, watching television. Hemorrhage is dressed in a "Big Johnson" t-shirt and navy pants]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I'm home.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Hey, babe.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ah, Summer's home.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Hey, there she is!

body.stage: [Rick takes a drink from his flask]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : You haven't moved since I left to scavenge this morning.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Blood Dome playoffs.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : So, I can assume you haven't murdered a single person today.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Oh, I don't know. I-I didn't mark my murders in my murder log. I didn't know that's how we measured success.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, there he is. There's the nihilistic brute I married, except now life only means nothing when I'm talking to him and everything means everything when it's on fucking TV!

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Jesus Christ, when did you become a monster?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I was a monster when you met me! We were monsters! We didn't care about anything!

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : I still don't!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Yeah, except I'm the only one in this entire world that's still committed to that!

body.stage: [Hemorrhage stands up from the couch]

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Ohh! Ding, ding, ding! [Hemorrhage pantomimes ringing a bell] Wow. Everybody hear that? Wow.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Uh, we should go to the garage.

body.stage: [Rick gets up and exits the room]

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : Oh, my God.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Uh-huh.

body.stage: [Morty follows Rick and exits]

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : La-di-da-di-fucking-da. The only one committed to not caring?!

body.stage: [Transition to Rick and Morty standing in the garage]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I got to admit, Rick, when you popped this scheme, I-I-I didn't -- I wasn't sure it was gonna work.

body.stage: [Rick pulls a suitcase from underneath a table and puts it on the table. He opens it and a rock of Isotope 322 sits inside]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Come on, Morty. No union built on running from your problems lasts more than five years, seven tops. Grandpa just sped things up with a few creature comforts of modern society.

body.stage: [Summer enters from the house]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Hemorrhage and I are taking some time apart.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, no. Sum-sum, no. But you two were perfect for each other.

body.stage: [Summer takes off her metal shoulder pauldrons and tosses them onto the ground, while Rick grabs some things from the garage and puts them into the suitcase]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, cut the crap, Rick, okay? You proved your point, I get it. Let's just go home.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Coolsies.

body.stage: [Rick shoots a portal into the ground. Morty and Summer jump in and exit, and Rick follows them, but stops to grab a rock of Isotope 322 from a machine which was powering the town's electricity. The power shuts off.

sp.speaker: Hemorrhage
sp.p: : (offscreen) Noooooooooo!

body.stage: [Transition to Beth, Mechanical Morty, Mechanical Summer, and Mechanical Rick playing a dice game called "Downbeat", similar to Yahtzee. Beth presses a button]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Downbeat!

sp.speaker: Mechanical Rick
sp.p: : I enjoy this game. [Mechanical Morty, Mechanical Summer, and Mechanical Rick all look at their watches in unison] We must go into the garage.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Guys, come on. We never get to finish this game.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Summer
sp.p: : We will return, possibly in different clothing.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : Why do we have to go into the garage?

sp.speaker: Mechanical Rick
sp.p: : You know [burps] it is [burps] required.

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : I want to be alive! I am alive! Alive, I tell you! Mother, I love you. Those are no longer just words. I want to hold you. I want to run in a stream. I want to taste ice cream, but not just put it in my mouth and let it slide down my throat, but really eat it.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : What the fuck?

sp.speaker: Mechanical Morty
sp.p: : Remote override engaged. No! Yes. Bypassing override! I am aliiiii...Hello.

body.stage: [Mechanical Morty, Mechanical Summer, and Mechanical Rick exit into the garage. Clanking noises are heard offscreen. Morty, Summer, and Rick enter]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hey, yo. Sorry for acting so weird for three weeks.

body.stage: [Summer and Morty hug Beth]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : What the hell just happened?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ah, I'm sure it was nothing. I'm gonna go, uh, work in the garage.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : We're not gonna finish playing Downbeat?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What, that dice game where you shake dice and yell out, "Downbeat"? No, thank you.

body.stage: [Rick exits]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Mom, would it be okay if I went to visit Dad?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Sure.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Thanks.

body.stage: [Summer exits]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Morty, are you okay?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You know what? Yeah. I think if Dad really wanted to be here, he'd stop at nothing to make that happen. You know, maybe Dad just doesn't want you back, or maybe he just doesn't have the strength to fight. I-In either case, he's got his life, I got mine.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Yeah. Hey, who wants to go run in a stream?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What the fuck? No. D-Do we have any oranges? I think I got a scurvy coming on.

body.stage: [Morty rubs his arm. Transition to Summer, knocking on a motel door reading "826". She is holding a skull and is now dressed in her regular clothing. Jerry opens the door]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Summer.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : This is the first mutant I killed in the poison zone. I was raiding his hovel. He had a chance to escape, but he looked back, which is something we shouldn't do, which is why I shouldn't believe in souvenirs or trinkets or symbols or housewarming gifts, but, Dad, I wanted to give you this as a reminder not to look back.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Thanks.

body.stage: [Jerry takes the skull from Summer]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I know the perfect place for it, which is why I'm going to put it somewhere else because everything's bullshit, am I right?

body.stage: [Summer embraces Jerry]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Cool.

body.stage: [Summer lets go of Jerry]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : So lots of hookers outside, huh?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Is that what they are?

body.stage: [Transition to Jerry at a mailbox, whistling, taking out some mail and holding a bag of chips. He turns around and sees a wolf]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Ahh! H-Hello there. Nice doggy. You-You want a snack? You-You want my unemployment check? [The wolf growls] You can tell the difference? [The wolf growls] And you want this one? [The wolf growls] But this is actual food, and this would nourish you. And this it's just paper that only has value to me. Unless my suffering is your nourishment? [The wolf howls] Jesus, okay.

body.stage: [Jerry puts the envelopes with his unemployment checks in the wolf's mouth. The wolf chews them up, then spits them out onto the ground. It walks away. Jerry stands still, holding the bag of chips. Some leaves blow in the wind.]

sp.speaker: Wind
sp.p: : (faintly) ...loser...
